result.execSummary:
The defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Stalking - Prev Conviction w/in 7 Yrs [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2m)(b).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Habitual Criminality], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Habitual Criminality], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Surcharge], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court found that the charges were an act of domestic abuse, but waived the surcharges.

records.addlTxt: LETTER ON BEHALF OF DEFENDANT

Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
Court ordered judgments of conviction as a habitual criminal and domestic abuse repeater to counts 2, 4, 5 and 6 as stated on the record.

  Statements as to sentencing by state and defense.  Additional statement/s by:  Alexandra E., Cornelius R. and Delbert T.
As to counts 1 and 3:
.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 2 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons as to each count, with credit for 415 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 1 year as to each count and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 1 year as to each count,  consecutive to each other but concurrent with the sentence the defendant is currently serving, with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to have no contact with the victim, Alexandra E. or the three children.
     *  The court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all applicable costs and surcharges. 
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank but waived any costs.
.
As to counts 4, 5 and 6:
.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons as to each count, with credit for -0- days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 years as to each count and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years as to each count,  consecutive to each other and consecutive to counts 1 and 3, but concurrent with the sentence the defendant is currently serving, with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to have no contact with the victim, Alexandra E. or the three children.
     *  The court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all applicable costs and surcharges. Court found that the charges were an act of domestice abuse but waived the surcharges.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank but waived any costs.

As to count 2:
.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 7 years in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for -0- days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 4 years and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years,  consecutive to all other charges but concurrent with the sentence the defendant is currently serving, with the following conditions:
     *  Successfully complete any counseling and/or
         treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Defendant to have no contact with the victim, Alexandra E. or the three children.
     *  The court found that the defendant is indigent and waived all applicable costs and surcharges. Court found that the charge was an act of domestice abuse but waived the surcharge.
     *  No contact with firearms.
     *  The Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence. 
     *  Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank but waived any costs.

The defendant is advised that as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms.  
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Wisconsin Abuse Program.
.

The jurors are back in court to continue their deliberations.
.
 At the hour of 9:37 a.m. the jury returned and by their foreperson, Marcia H.,  brought in verdicts of GUILTY AS TO ALL 6 COUNTS, which were then read.    Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.

Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are back to continue with the trial.
.
Jury back in box.   Defendant back on the witness stand to continue his testimony.  Defense rests.   Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Alexandria E..
State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Exhibit 21 received.

Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror Eric L. selected by lot.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:52 p.m. to deliberate in charge of Deputy Sheriffs Donnie Rutter and Robert Pekar who were duly sworn for that purpose.  
.
At the hour of 4:55 p.m. the jury was released for the evening and instructed to return tomorrow at 08:45 a.m.
.

Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Jurors back in court. 
 Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Zachary Thoms, Milwaukee Police Officer and Cole Stephens, Forensic Document Examiner for the Milwaukee Police Department.  Exhibit 1 received.  Sworn for the State:  Anna Linden, Investigator for the District Attorney's Office.  Court read into the record the parties stipulation.  State rests.
 State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss is denied by the court.  
The defendant wants to testify.  The court questioned the defendant as to his decision to testify.  Defense counsel questioned the defendant as to his decision to testify against his advice.  Court found that the defendant freely,  voluntarily and intelligently made his decision.  
Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Terrance Egerson, the defendant.  
.
Court will adjourn for the lunch hour...
.
Case passed until the afternoon....

cab
Jury out of box.  Stipulation received and filed.

.
Jury back in court.
  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Alexandria E., citizen witness.  Exhibits 3 through 7 received.  Exhibits 12 through 17 received.  Exhibit 18 received.  Sworn for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officers, Peter Graber and Natasha Delgado.   Exhibit 11 received.

Case will adjourn for the evening.

Jurors instructed to report back to court to continue with the trial by 08:30 a.m.

Court questioned the defendant and his attorney as to his signed stipulation.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently signed the stipulation.

Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  cab
Amended Information filed. 
Defendant is charged as follows:

Count 1:  Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 813.12(4) and (8)(a), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(a), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), a Misdemeanor.

Count 2: Stalking - Previous Conviction Within 7 years, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Domestic Abuse Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 940.32(2m)(b), 939.50 (3)(h), 939.62(1)(b), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), 973.055(1), 940.32(2m)(b), 939.50(3)(h), 939.62(1)(b), 973.055(1), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), a Class H Felony.

Count 3:   Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 813.12(4) and (8)(a), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(a), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), a Misdemeanor.

Count 4:  Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 813.12(4) and (8)(a), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(a), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), a Misdemeanor.

Count 5:  Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 813.12(4) and (8)(a), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(a), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), a Misdemeanor.

Count 6:  Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Habitual Criminality Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 813.12(4) and (8)(a), 973.055(1), 939.62(1)(a), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), a Misdemeanor.

The court made corrections to the amended information as follows:
Count 3:  Offense date, 12/19/2014; Count 4:  Offense date, January 7, 2015; Count 5:  Offense date, 01/05/2015; Count 6:  Offense date, 02/09/2015.

Defendant's motion filed asking the court to remove the district attorney for malicious prosecution was denied by the court.

Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  10:27 a.m..  
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause and who were duly impaneled and sworn at 11:45 a.m..  Jury list received and filed.
  Court instructed jury.  
The court will adjourn for the lunch hour and continue the trial at 02:00 p.m.

Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Arraignment. Defendant has filed a motion to challenge Count 3. Parties stipulate to adjourning case for a motion hearing and arraignment date, and to vacating the Jury Trial date of 6/29/2015, GRANTED by the court. Court found that the defendant knowingly and willingly waived his Arraignment time limits. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Court further found that the defendant knowingly and willingly withdrew his Speedy Trial Demand and Demand for a Prompt Disposition. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Motion To Dismiss Count 3 for Violation of the 1st Amendment.
Received & Filed, State's Motion In Limine.
Received & Filed, State's Witness List.

Attorney Justin Singleton in court, defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski for Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received & Filed, Cover Letter from CDDA Kent Lovern and attached Copy of Request for Prompt Disposition and Detainer.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: District Attorney Victim/Witness Advocate Michelle Crivello. Court took Judicial Notice of certified documents attached to the complaint and the location of Stanley Correctional Facility.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. State requested an adjourned arraignment date.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Case set for Arraignment and Jury Trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.

Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in court with attorney Jeff Szczewski for Justin Singleton.  Defendant Terrance Lavone Egerson in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Received & Filed, Amended Criminal Complaint by the state, which recharged Count 3 that was previously dismissed at the initial appearance and reads: 
COUNT 3: Stalking- Previous Conviction W/IN 7 YRS, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, contrary to Wis. Stat. 940.32(2m), 939.50(3)(h), 939.62(1)(b), 939.62(1)(b) and (2), 973.055(1), a class H Felony. 
Copy provided to defense counsel, who waived reading. Court corrected error as to date listed in complaint as to count 3 with stipulation of parties.  Arraignment scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
